listitem.para: Macro for converting string literial to RAPIDJSON_ERROR_CHARTYPE[].
Macro to indicate a parse error.
(Internal) macro to indicate and handle a parse error.

enum ParseErrorCode { kParseErrorNone = 0 , kParseErrorDocumentEmpty , kParseErrorDocumentRootNotSingular , kParseErrorValueInvalid , kParseErrorObjectMissName , kParseErrorObjectMissColon , kParseErrorObjectMissCommaOrCurlyBracket , kParseErrorArrayMissCommaOrSquareBracket , kParseErrorStringUnicodeEscapeInvalidHex , kParseErrorStringUnicodeSurrogateInvalid , kParseErrorStringEscapeInvalid , kParseErrorStringMissQuotationMark , kParseErrorStringInvalidEncoding , kParseErrorNumberTooBig , kParseErrorNumberMissFraction , kParseErrorNumberMissExponent , kParseErrorTermination , kParseErrorUnspecificSyntaxError }

enum ValidateErrorCode { kValidateErrors = -1 , kValidateErrorNone = 0 , kValidateErrorMultipleOf , kValidateErrorMaximum , kValidateErrorExclusiveMaximum , kValidateErrorMinimum , kValidateErrorExclusiveMinimum , kValidateErrorMaxLength , kValidateErrorMinLength , kValidateErrorPattern , kValidateErrorMaxItems , kValidateErrorMinItems , kValidateErrorUniqueItems , kValidateErrorAdditionalItems , kValidateErrorMaxProperties , kValidateErrorMinProperties , kValidateErrorRequired , kValidateErrorAdditionalProperties , kValidateErrorPatternProperties , kValidateErrorDependencies , kValidateErrorEnum , kValidateErrorType , kValidateErrorOneOf , kValidateErrorOneOfMatch , kValidateErrorAllOf , kValidateErrorAnyOf , kValidateErrorNot }
Maps error code of parsing into error message.
Maps error code of validation into error message.

section.title: RAPIDJSON_ERROR_CHARTYPE
section.para: The default character type is char. On Windows, user can define this macro as TCHAR for supporting both unicode/non-unicode settings.

section.title: RAPIDJSON_ERROR_STRING

para.para: Macro for converting string literial to RAPIDJSON_ERROR_CHARTYPE[].

section.para: By default this conversion macro does nothing. On Windows, user can define this macro as _T(x) for supporting both unicode/non-unicode settings.

section.title: RAPIDJSON_PARSE_ERROR

para.para: (Internal) macro to indicate and handle a parse error.

section.para:
Parameters
parseErrorCode
rapidjson::ParseErrorCode of the error
offset
position of the error in JSON input (size_t)
Invokes RAPIDJSON_PARSE_ERROR_NORETURN and stops the parsing.

section.title: RAPIDJSON_PARSE_ERROR_NORETURN
section.programlisting: RAPIDJSON_MULTILINEMACRO_BEGIN \ RAPIDJSON_ASSERT(!HasParseError()); /* Error can only be assigned once */ \ SetParseError(parseErrorCode, offset); \ RAPIDJSON_MULTILINEMACRO_END

para.para: Macro to indicate a parse error.

section.para:
Parameters
parseErrorCode
rapidjson::ParseErrorCode of the error
offset
position of the error in JSON input (size_t)
This macros can be used as a customization point for the internal error handling mechanism of RapidJSON.
A common usage model is to throw an exception instead of requiring the caller to explicitly check the rapidjson::GenericReader::Parse's return value:

section.title: GetParseErrorFunc
section.para: This is the prototype for GetParseError_X(), where X is a locale. User can dynamically change locale in runtime, e.g.: GetParseErrorFunc GetParseError = GetParseError_En; // or whatever const RAPIDJSON_ERROR_CHARTYPE* s = GetParseError(document.GetParseErrorCode());

section.title: GetValidateErrorFunc
section.para: This is the prototype for GetValidateError_X(), where X is a locale. User can dynamically change locale in runtime, e.g.: GetValidateErrorFunc GetValidateError = GetValidateError_En; // or whatever const RAPIDJSON_ERROR_CHARTYPE* s = GetValidateError(validator.GetInvalidSchemaCode());

entry.para: Number is not a multiple of the 'multipleOf' value.

entry.para: Number is greater than the 'maximum' value.

entry.para: Number is greater than or equal to the 'maximum' value.

entry.para: Number is less than the 'minimum' value.

entry.para: Number is less than or equal to the 'minimum' value.

entry.para: String is longer than the 'maxLength' value.

row.entry: kValidateErrorMinLengthRapidJSON error handling RapidJSON error handlingkValidateErrorMinLength kValidateErrorMinLength

entry.para: String is longer than the 'maxLength' value.

entry.para: String does not match the 'pattern' regular expression.

entry.para: Array is longer than the 'maxItems' value.

row.entry: kValidateErrorMinItemsRapidJSON error handling RapidJSON error handlingkValidateErrorMinItems kValidateErrorMinItems

entry.para: Array is shorter than the 'minItems' value.

row.entry: kValidateErrorUniqueItemsRapidJSON error handling RapidJSON error handlingkValidateErrorUniqueItems kValidateErrorUniqueItems

entry.para: Array has duplicate items but 'uniqueItems' is true.

entry.para: Array has additional items that are not allowed by the schema.

row.entry: kValidateErrorMaxPropertiesRapidJSON error handling RapidJSON error handlingkValidateErrorMaxProperties kValidateErrorMaxProperties

entry.para: Object has more members than 'maxProperties' value.

row.entry: kValidateErrorMinPropertiesRapidJSON error handling RapidJSON error handlingkValidateErrorMinProperties kValidateErrorMinProperties

entry.para: Object has less members than 'minProperties' value.

row.entry: kValidateErrorRequiredRapidJSON error handling RapidJSON error handlingkValidateErrorRequired kValidateErrorRequired

entry.para: Object is missing one or more members required by the schema.

row.entry: kValidateErrorAdditionalPropertiesRapidJSON error handling RapidJSON error handlingkValidateErrorAdditionalProperties kValidateErrorAdditionalProperties

entry.para: Object has additional members that are not allowed by the schema.

entry.para: See other errors.

entry.para: Object has missing property or schema dependencies.

entry.para: Property has a value that is not one of its allowed enumerated values.

row.entry: kValidateErrorTypeRapidJSON error handling RapidJSON error handlingkValidateErrorType kValidateErrorType

entry.para: Property has a type that is not allowed by the schema..

entry.para: Property did not match any of the sub-schemas specified by 'oneOf'.

entry.para: Property matched more than one of the sub-schemas specified by 'oneOf'.

entry.para: Property did not match all of the sub-schemas specified by 'allOf'.

entry.para: Property did not match any of the sub-schemas specified by 'anyOf'.

entry.para: Property matched the sub-schema specified by 'not'.

para.para: Maps error code of parsing into error message.

row.entry: parseErrorCode

entry.para: Error code obtained in parsing.

note.title: Note
note.para: User can make a copy of this function for localization. Using switch-case is safer for future modification of error codes.

para.para: Maps error code of validation into error message.

row.entry: validateErrorCode

entry.para: Error code obtained from validator.

note.title: Note
note.para: User can make a copy of this function for localization. Using switch-case is safer for future modification of error codes.
